body_html:
I got the same error on when using the Anaconda3-4.4.0. There might be other dependencies that are needed that are not mentioned when installed with pip. Maybe it could be an issue with GCC.

I got this error in ubuntu 14.04 and CentOS Linux 7

Here's a minimal example:

import numpy as np
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
from torch.autograd import Variable

img = np.random.randint(254,size=(1,3,20,30))
net = nn.Conv2d(3, 1, kernel_size=3)

img = Variable(torch.from_numpy(img), volatile=True)
print("torch variable", img)
out = net(img)
print(out)  # never reaches this line as crashes line before.

Error similar to above:
*** Error in `python': free(): invalid pointer: 0x00007f1c2f5b9ac0 ***
======= Backtrace: =========
/lib64/libc.so.6(+0x7d053)[0x7f1c47d1e053]
...

body:
I got the same error on when using the Anaconda3-4.4.0.  There might be other dependencies that are needed that are not mentioned when installed with pip.  Maybe it could be an issue with GCC.

I got this error in ubuntu 14.04 and CentOS Linux 7

Here's a minimal example:

    import numpy as np
    import torch
    import torch.nn as nn
    from torch.autograd import Variable

    img = np.random.randint(254,size=(1,3,20,30))
    net = nn.Conv2d(3, 1, kernel_size=3)

    img = Variable(torch.from_numpy(img), volatile=True)
    print("torch variable", img)
    out = net(img)
    print(out)  # never reaches this line as crashes line before.

Error similar to above:
    *** Error in `python': free(): invalid pointer: 0x00007f1c2f5b9ac0 ***
    ======= Backtrace: =========
    /lib64/libc.so.6(+0x7d053)[0x7f1c47d1e053]
        ...
